snippet: Brig. Gen. Jeffrey A. Sinclair offered to plead guilty to other, less-serious counts of misconduct, but still wants to face in court his accuser, a junior officer who says she was sexually assaulted.
abstract: Brig Gen Jeffrey A Sinclair says that he will plead guilty to less serious counts of misconduct, hoping to narrow his court-martial to a showdown with a woman who accused him of sexual assault; says he will plead guilty to adultery, soliciting explicit images and impeding an investigation.

byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER and RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr
byline.contributor: Alan Blinder reported from Fort Bragg and Richard A. Oppel Jr. from New York.

lead_paragraph: Brig. Gen. Jeffrey A. Sinclair offered to plead guilty to other, less-serious counts of misconduct, but still wants to face in court his accuser, a junior officer who says she was sexually assaulted.

headline.main: Army General Offers Plea to Narrow Assault Case
headline.print_headline: Army General Offers Plea to Narrow Assault Case

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
